verses.verse: The sin<WH2403> of Judah<WH3063> is written<WH3789> with a pen<WH5842> of iron<WH1270>, and with the point<WH6856> of a diamond<WH8068>: it is graven<WH2790> upon the tablet<WH3871> of their heart<WH3820>, and upon the horns<WH7161> of your altars<WH4196>;
whilst their children<WH1121> remember<WH2142> their altars<WH4196> and their Asherim<WH842> by the green<WH7488> trees<WH6086> upon the high<WH1364> hills<WH1389>.

O my mountain<WH2042> in the field<WH7704>, I will give<WH5414> thy substance<WH2428> and all thy treasures<WH214> for a spoil<WH957>, and thy high places<WH1116>, because of sin<WH2403>, throughout all thy borders<WH1366>.

And thou<WH8058>, even of thyself, shalt discontinue from thy heritage<WH5159> that I gave<WH5414> thee<WH5647>; and I will cause thee to serve thine enemies<WH341> in the land<WH776> which thou knowest<WH3045> not<WH6919>: for ye have kindled a fire<WH784> in mine anger<WH639> which shall burn<WH3344> for<WH5704> ever<WH5769>.

Thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>: Cursed<WH779> is the man<WH1397> that trusteth<WH982> in man<WH120>, and maketh<WH7760> flesh<WH1320> his arm<WH2220>, and whose heart<WH3820> departeth<WH5493> from Jehovah<WH3068>.

For he shall be like the heath<WH6199> in the desert<WH6160>, and shall not see<WH7200> when good<WH2896> cometh<WH935>, but shall inhabit<WH7931> the parched places<WH2788> in the wilderness<WH4057>, a salt<WH4420> land<WH776> and not inhabited<WH3427>.
Blessed <WH1288> is the man<WH1397> that trusteth<WH982> in Jehovah<WH3068>, and whose trust<WH4009> Jehovah is<WH3068>.

For he shall be as a tree<WH6086> planted<WH8362> by the waters<WH4325>, that spreadeth out<WH7971> its roots<WH8328> by the river<WH3105>, and shall not fear<WH7200> when heat<WH2527> cometh<WH935>, but its leaf<WH5929> shall be green<WH7488>; and shall not be careful<WH1672> in the year<WH8141> of drought<WH1226>, neither shall cease<WH4185> from yielding<WH6213> fruit<WH6529>.
The heart<WH3820> is deceitful<WH6121> above all things<WH605>, and it is exceedingly corrupt: who can know it<WH3045>?

I <WH3068>, Jehovah, search<WH2713> the mind<WH3820>, I try<WH974> the heart<WH3820>, even to give<WH5414> every man<WH376> according to his ways<WH1870>, according to the fruit<WH6529> of his doings<WH4611>.

As the partridge<WH7124> that sitteth<WH1716> on eggs which she hath not laid<WH3205>, so is he that getteth<WH6213> riches<WH6239>, and not by right<WH4941>; in the midst<WH2677> of his days<WH3117> they shall leave<WH5800> him<WH319>, and at his end he shall be a fool<WH5036>.
A glorious<WH3519> throne<WH3678>, set on high<WH4791> from the beginning<WH7223>, is the place<WH4725> of our sanctuary<WH4720>.

O Jehovah<WH3068>, the hope<WH4723> of Israel<WH3478>, all that forsake<WH5800> thee shall be put to shame<WH954>. They that depart<WH3249> from me<WH5493> shall be written<WH3789> in the earth<WH776>, because they have forsaken<WH5800> Jehovah<WH3068>, the fountain<WH4726> of living<WH2416> waters<WH4325>.
Heal <WH7495> me<WH3068>, O Jehovah, and I shall be healed<WH7495>; save<WH3467> me<WH3467>, and I shall be saved: for thou art my praise<WH8416>.
Behold <WH559>, they say unto me<WH1697>, Where is the word of Jehovah<WH3068>? let it come now<WH935>.

As for me<WH213>, I have not hastened from being a shepherd<WH7462> after<WH310> thee<WH183>; neither have I desired the woeful<WH605> day<WH3117>; thou knowest<WH3045>: that which came out<WH4161> of my lips<WH8193> was before<WH5227> thy face<WH6440>.
Be not a terror<WH4288> unto me<WH4268>: thou art my refuge in the day<WH3117> of evil<WH7451>.

Let them be put to shame<WH954> that persecute<WH7291> me<WH954>, but let not me be put to shame; let them be dismayed<WH2865>, but let not me be dismayed<WH2865>; bring<WH935> upon them the day<WH3117> of evil<WH7451>, and destroy<WH7665> them with double<WH4932> destruction<WH7670>.

Thus said<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068> unto me<WH1980>: Go, and stand<WH5975> in the gate<WH8179> of the children<WH1121> of the people<WH5971>, whereby the kings<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> come in<WH935>, and by which they go out<WH3318>, and in all the gates<WH8179> of Jerusalem<WH3389>;

and say<WH559> unto them<WH8085>, Hear ye the word<WH1697> of Jehovah<WH3068>, ye kings<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063>, and all Judah<WH3063>, and all the inhabitants<WH3427> of Jerusalem<WH3389>, that enter in<WH935> by these gates<WH8179>:

Thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, Take heed<WH8104> to yourselves<WH5315>, and bear<WH5375> no burden<WH4853> on the sabbath<WH7676> day<WH3117>, nor bring<WH935> it in by the gates<WH8179> of Jerusalem<WH3389>;

neither carry forth<WH3318> a burden<WH4853> out of your houses<WH1004> on the sabbath<WH7676> day<WH3117>, neither do<WH6213> ye any work<WH4399>: but hallow<WH6942> ye the sabbath<WH7676> day<WH3117>, as I commanded<WH6680> your fathers<WH1>.

But they hearkened<WH8085> not<WH5186>, neither inclined their ear<WH241>, but made their neck<WH6203> stiff<WH7185>, that they might not hear<WH8085>, and might not receive<WH3947> instruction<WH4148>.

And it shall come to pass<WH8085>, if ye diligently hearken<WH8085> unto me<WH5002>, saith Jehovah<WH3068>, to bring<WH935> in no burden<WH4853> through the gates<WH8179> of this city<WH5892> on the sabbath<WH7676> day<WH3117>, but to hallow<WH6942> the sabbath<WH7676> day<WH3117>, to do<WH6213> no<WH1115> work therein<WH4399>;

then shall there enter<WH935> in by the gates<WH8179> of this city<WH5892> kings<WH4428> and princes<WH8269> sitting<WH3427> upon the throne<WH3678> of David<WH1732>, riding<WH7392> in chariots<WH7393> and on horses<WH5483>, they<WH8269>, and their princes, the men<WH376> of Judah<WH3063>, and the inhabitants<WH3427> of Jerusalem<WH3389>; and this city<WH5892> shall remain<WH3427> for ever<WH5769>.

And they shall come<WH935> from the cities<WH5892> of Judah<WH3063>, and from the places round about<WH5439> Jerusalem<WH3389>, and from the land<WH776> of Benjamin<WH1144>, and from the lowland<WH8219>, and from the hill-country<WH2022>, and from the South<WH5045>, bringing<WH935> burnt-offerings<WH5930>, and sacrifices<WH2077>, and meal-offerings<WH4503>, and frankincense<WH3828>, and bringing<WH935> sacrifices of thanksgiving<WH8426>, unto the house<WH1004> of Jehovah<WH3068>.

But if ye will not hearken<WH8085> unto me to hallow<WH6942> the sabbath<WH7676> day<WH3117>, and not to bear<WH5375> a burden<WH4853> and enter in<WH935> at the gates<WH8179> of Jerusalem<WH3389> on the sabbath<WH7676> day<WH3117>; then will I kindle<WH3341> a fire<WH784> in the gates<WH8179> thereof<WH398>, and it shall devour the palaces<WH759> of Jerusalem<WH3389>, and it shall not be quenched<WH3518>.
